data.yet: = Is this just due to a lack of time from the list maintainers
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
This module has already been submitted:

    http://archive.develooper.com/modules@perl.org/msg10035.html

    It is available on CPAN, with full doc and tests; updates are
    planned RSN.

    I write to modules@perl.org again to ask two questions: - I finaly
    chose to use Log::Procmail, since it was the simplest and most
    straightforward name for this module. I can still change it to any
    of: Mail::Procmail::Log; Mail::ProcmailLog or Logfile::Procmail (see
    the mail linked above for the rationale). Should I?

    - I suppose it's perfectly normal that it's not in the module list
    yet: = Is this just due to a lack of time from the list maintainers
    (which is perfectly understandable, when one looks at the volume of
    mail exchanged on modules@perl.org)? = Or has the module a problem
    (namespace, or chapter maybe?) that prevents its inclusion?
